document.docAuthor: Gobbi, Fernanda T. & Azevedo, Celso O.
document.docTitle: Caloapenesia mugra Gobbi & Azevedo, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of Caloapenesia (Hymenoptera, Bethylidae), with description of sixteen new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of Caloapenesia (Hymenoptera, Bethylidae), with description of sixteen new species

heading.emphasis:
Caloapenesia mugra Gobbi & Azevedo
, sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. MALE. Body length 3.8 mm . LFW 2.6 mm . Color . Head, clypeus and mesosoma black; antennae, mandible and metasoma castaneous; legs light castaneous; wings subhyaline.

Head (
Fig. 11
). Mandible with five apical teeth; uppermost one blunt, others angulate; large, subequal in length. Median clypeal lobe subrectangular; apical margin strongly medially ventrad, with median tooth slightly conspicuous; carina high, arched in profile. Antennal torulus slightly prominent. Flagellomeres median-sized; four first antennomeres in ratio about 14 : 3 : 6 : 6 ; pedicel short, 0.75 × as long as wide; flagellomere I 1.20 × as long as wide; flagellomere IX 1.25 × as long as wide; flagellar pubescence suberect and erect, about half of diameter of flagellomeres. Frons polished; densely punctate. WH 0.93 × LH. WF 0.75 × LH. WF 1.90 x HE. Eye small, salient; pilosity sparse. Ocellus small.
DAO
0.14 × WF; frontal angle of ocellar triangle acute. WOT 3.3 ×
DAO
. OOL 1.0 × WOT. Distance of posterior ocellus to vertex crest 1.60 ×
DAO
. VOL 1.20 × HE. Temple subparallel. Vertex straight. Occipital carina complete, not visible in dorsal view.

Material examined.
Holotype
, ♂. THAILAND , Chaiyaphum, Tat Tone NP, By the creek at Takfah waterfall,
15 ° 56.463 ’N
102 ° 5.953 ’E
, 242 m , Malaise trap,
19–26 .ix. 2006
, Tawit Jaruphan & Orawan Budsawong leg., T 872 , QSBG .

Distribution. Thailand (Chaiyaphum, Chiang Mai, Nong Bua Lampoo, Phetchabun).

Remarks.
Caloapenesia mugra
sp. nov.
resembles
C. rikawa
sp. nov.
and
C. inyara
sp. nov.
by presents clypeus rounded; ocellus and eye small. But
C. mugra
sp. nov.
presents uppermost tooth only angulate; flagellomeres median-sized; pedicel short; propodeal disc elongate; hypopygium with median lobe shorter than in
C. rikawa
sp. nov.
; lateral stalk more conspicuous than in
C. inyara
sp. nov.
and
C. rikawa
sp. nov.
